title.value: Latent Idiom Recognition for a Minimalist Functional Array Language using Equality Saturation
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Latent Idiom Recognition for a Minimalist Functional Array Language using Equality Saturation

extractions.description: This paper presents a minimalist approach to functional array programming using equality saturation for idiom recognition and rewriting. It shows how a compact set of rewrite rules can be used to express and recognize idioms in libraries such as BLAS and PyTorch, leading to significant performance improvements in computational kernels.

type.justification: The paper includes experimental results that demonstrate the effectiveness of using equality saturation for idiom recognition in computational kernels.
type.quote: To evaluate LIAR’s effectiveness, this work applies it to custom kernels, and to linear algebra and numerical simulation kernels from the PolyBench suite.

name.justification: The paper focuses on optimizing computational kernels which are foundational in deep learning applications.
name.quote: Compared to reference C kernel implementations, the approach produces a geometric mean speedup of 1.46× for C programs using BLAS, when generating such programs from the high-level minimalist language.

name.justification: The main contribution of the paper involves optimizing computational kernels by recognizing and rewriting code idioms.
name.quote: Latent Idiom Array Rewriting (LIAR) efficiently transforms programs to expose hidden idioms and improve program efficiency.

name.justification: The paper presents rewrite rules for recognizing and utilizing BLAS library functions.
name.quote: This paper proposes to find such intuitive solutions using Latent Idiom Array Rewriting (LIAR), a trustworthy technique that finds and exploits latent idioms using equality saturation. [...] This paper shows how this technique can be applied on a subset of the Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS) libraries.
